title: Fox Lies - Cenk Busts Fox News On MSNBC

comments.text:
Fox News Channel beats out CNN, ABC, CBS and NBC for America's most trusted 
cable or broadcast news coverage, and MSNBC lags far behind, even among 
Democrats, according to new polling done by Quinnipiac University. 
Washington Post
March 9, 2015﻿

+SwaggerLikeMe2009 
What is your point?
1. Fox News has turned the country into a state of disarray?
2. The country is so screwed up that they trust Fox News?
And our country is in complete disarray. Coincidence?
comments.author: SwaggerLikeMe2009

comments.text:
Anyone who dosent realize that Fox is all bullshit and one sided is just 
retarted ! Its not news ! They are caught lying daily !!﻿
comments.author: Salvatore Lanzieri

comments.text: He was definitely going to say bullshit at the end but caught himself﻿
comments.author: masterbaitersfishing

comments.text:
Hahahaha... Ur totally right. Good catch! Thought he just fumbled his 
words... But ur spot on. Had to remember where he was for a minute. Hahahaha
comments.author: SwaggerLikeMe2009

comments.text:
The last one was not a lie... If they mentioned that protests were 
happening throughout the country, then they reserve the right to show any 
video of any protest... hello? At worst, the specific context could have 
led to "possible misinterpretation", in the case that the viewer can't 
connect the dots themselves by looking at the damn trees. If Fox News is 
the great manipulator and schemer you claim them to be, they could have 
simply edited out the brief showing of the Palm Trees... Is this the best 
you have against O'Reilly? ﻿
comments.author: killerbutle

comments.text:
My mistake, I wasn't descriptive enough in my comment. I meant on an 
accumulative scale from all the networks and even comedic political 
commentary shows that give examples of Fox news manipulating content. 
Constant polling shows it's a fact that the most consistently misinformed 
media viewers are Fox viewers.

In this personal instance I do feel that Fox did try to mislead you. Maybe 
you need watch the video again but the order of deliverance of the content 
along with the commentary did imply it was in that state. Those background 
trees are not obvious nor did they give an indication as to where they were 
shooting like all other professional networks do. 

This also has nothing do with being biased. It's about being misleading. 
And no lying is never okay. Lying and misleading the sheep is exactly how 
we started a Trillion dollar war, a recession, amongst so many other 
problems.
comments.author: Rukkiss OFFICIAL

comments.text:
+Rukkiss OFFICIAL If there are thousands of examples then it's pathetic

thought they were supposed to be top notch journalists. That's my point. 
TYT is misleading their audience in a video that claim's Fox misleads it's 
audience. Hypocrisy much. Please use your brain and see that the world 
isn't so black and white, everybody lies, everybody is biased.

comments.text:

comments.text:
See, this is again more nonsense, as this is what FDR said about Collective 
Bargaining:  "Roosevelt absolutely did not favor collective bargaining for 
federal workers and especially did not favor the right to strike," 
public-sector labor scholar Joseph McCartin told Salon.com shortly after 
Walker’s dramatic action in 2011.

And the current head of the National Federation of Federal Employees says 
Roosevelt’s words meant he "believed that there should be no right to 
federal bargaining over wages and benefits."  Also, I know many believe FDR 
would have 'evolved' on the issue but both what Scott Walker said and what 
Glenn Beck said was true.  Also, it is important to separate opinion shows 
like Beck's and O'Reilley's, etc., from hard news.  As that is where people 
do not want to see bias.  As everyone knows there is going to be bias to 
the left if you watch Cenk and bias to the right if you watch Hannity.  But 
Fox, it seems - with straight news, does a pretty job.﻿

comments.text:
That was the most pathetic piece of journalism I've seen in years.

It gives the overwhelming impression of somebody deciding that they had to 
do an item on Fox News lying and then combing hours and hours of video to 
try and find some examples and failing miserably.

1. Glenn Beck doesn't present news and doesn't claim to. It's an opinion 
show.

2. Gingrich was a guest on the show not the presenter. You can't regulate 
what guests decide to say when you interview them.

3. The numbers given by Megan Kelly weren't wrong., They the correct 
numbers. They didn't claim to take experience and qualifications into 
account. If Fat Boy Cenk feels there is a better way of doing it - fine. 
But that's very different from Fox ';lying'.

4. O''Reilly didn't lie about anything here. Nor did he make any false 
claims.

Is this really the best evidence TYT could find? 

It's funny how Cenk at the beginning of the piece claims to have examples 
of Fox News lying yet at the end after he presents his 'evidence' he only 
claims that they mislead.

No wonder he can't hack it in the real media.﻿

comments.text:
Holy fail video. Let's take it from the top.
1) O'Relly's point was that these people are sheep that only know they are 
screaming what they are screaming because someone else told them to.
2) Glenn Beck is gone and that was just a slight exaggeration. 
3) Let us count all the lies in Obama's campaign. I'm sure that Walker 
mentioned straightening out the budget. Well guess what, it's straightened 
out. Union's had to take a haircut like everybody else.Plus wasn't Newt a 
candidate for Prez at that time? 
4) The challenge to the average salary vs avg salary chart is just 
retarded. Taking into acct peoples educations? Do they do that with 
unemployment numbers or any others? Come on.
5)I'll give you that one but it's not as bad as the many despicable edits 
from MSNBC.

I can tell you that if all you got is 1/2 of 1, Fox is way ahead of the 
field. Between CNN just guessing at the news and MSNBC blatantly misleading 
people, Fox is pretty well balanced.﻿
comments.author: carlos yanes

comments.text:
1) Sheep that he gladly exploits every time he opens his gaping hole.

2) So you're supporting that he shouldn't have been there in the first 
place. The only thing we agree on. Though I doubt you'd agree that he needs 
to be taken down with his other cushy little propaganda radio show that's 
failing in ratings (along with his disgusting toadie friend Limbaugh, who 
should be shoved in a hole and left to rot) so fast and hard because so 
many people have pushed his previous monetary support away that the hard 
core Tea Party backers have had to step in to keep them on the air.

3) Let's count all the lies in Mitt Romney's campaign. I'm sure we'll trump 
Obama in flip-flopping on issues alone. Not saying Obama is that great, but 
he was a better choice than a bible humping Mormon with a silver spoon in 
his mouth and a shit ton of special interests shoved up his ass. (Not that 
Obama doesn't have his own, but they're less numerous and toxic to the 
country.)

4) They are only comparing salaries, not job titles. That is purposefully 
misleading. Does a kid working a deep fryer make more than his supervisor? 
OF COURSE NOT. So you have to factor in those things to be accurate. 
Bashing someone for being accurate doesn't make you look smart -- in fact, 
it tends to make you look like a fool.

5) Congratulations, you've realized that main stream media sucks balls. Now 
hopefully you'll stop being a sheeple for O'Reilly's spoon-feedings.

Fox is a propaganda machine, just like the rest of the mainstream media. 
Fox is just blatant, ignorant (willfully or otherwise), disgusting and 
completely unapologetic about it.

comments.author: Edward Nigma

comments.text:

comments.author: Christopher Tyler

comments.text:
+Christopher Tyler That's just it.  There is some hard news.  However, it 
is just a small percentage of the whole broadcast.  It's called 
extrapolation.  They get a news fact........then they build on it, 
embellish it, make inferences on it.  The result is a theory based on a few 
facts and a bunch of other opinionated rhetoric.  I am not saying that the 
other news doesn't do it, I am just saying that Fox does it more 
comprehensively and consistently.
comments.author: D DA

comments.text:
+D DA Well, if that is the case, I suppose I can agree.  As I know they 
filled a marketplace need in America, but I certainly don't think they like 
purposefully when presenting hard news or at any other time, frankly.  They 
all have strong opinions, however.
comments.author: Christopher Tyler

comments.text:
+Christopher Tyler I am not sure how the subject changed to "me having a 
problem".  I am just explaining a business model that the other cable news 
outlets are unable to duplicate in the lockstep fashion Fox does.  No other 
cable news outlets puts together and executes a plan in such a 
single-minded message-driven format.  Again I am complimenting Fox News for 
doing such an excellent job at driving talking points home better than any 
other cable news outlet.
comments.author: D DA

comments.text:
Not sure how that is a response as to proving your point.  Please just 
bring me hard newscasts where Fox lies.  As I think we are all well aware 
that their commentators are conservatives.  They actually have quite a few 
democrats who report the news, however.  Brett Bair, Shep Smith, etc.  I 
believe Greta is a Democrat also and she has an opinion show.  Fox also has 
lots of democrats on to give their views, so I am not quite sure what your 
problem is.
comments.author: Christopher Tyler

comments.text:
"Make sure these so-called lies come from the news 
division".................you nailed it.  The apparatus is started by "news 
opinion" people in the morning............a few hours later the "news" 
people promote these "opinions" as "earlier reports"...........so by 
primetime it becomes the news based on reports gathered by "news" people. 
 That's how it gets put together by the end of the day.  FOX Fair And 
Balanced!
comments.author: D DA

comments.text:
+D DA Just give me five (5) very specific lies, which are intentional 
falsehoods, and then the evidence that allows us to know that any 
statements made that were factually wrong were done on purpose.

Make sure these so-called lies come from the news division, too, please, as 
opinion/commentary is something altogether different.

Agenda - driven?  Of course Fox with its commentaries and opinion shows 
caters to conservatism.  Why is that?  Because for so long the major media 
(the big three - ABC, NBC, and CBS) had a bias.

MSNBC is clearly agenda driven in the liberal direction, but I don't say 
that they lie.  Even though, I have to say, I could probably make a pretty 
good case of it if one looks at the reporting with respect to Michael Brown 
case where the channel certainly led people to believe that Michael Brown 
had his hands up even though President Obama's Justice Department concluded 
that there was no credible evidence to support that at all.

But most of that stuff came from commentators like Sharpton and Ed Shultz, 
etc., and I'd have to go back and look at their hard news casts to see if 
they ever lied.  I doubt they would, however, as there is far too much to 
lose if networks like these out and out lie.  Though MSNBC is a rather 
small outlet compared to Fox, but nonetheless.
comments.author: Christopher Tyler

comments.text:
You do realize that youtube has a vast amount of video exposing Fox 
Lies........and this "purposeful falsehood" is an understatement.  The 
Channel is agenda-driven.............not news-worthy story driven.  The 
news is not news anymore.  It's a show that is designed to arouse emotions 
persuading millions to think a certain way for the benefit of the owners of 
the TV Stations.  It's a two-pronged attack to alter the opinions of many 
viewers while creating revenue.  Only naive people think it is news.

the public service," Roosevelt wrote in 1937 to the National Federation of 
Federal Employees. Yes, public workers may demand fair treatment, wrote 
Roosevelt. But, he wrote, "I want to emphasize my conviction that militant 
tactics have no place" in the public sector. "A strike of public employees 
manifests nothing less than an intent on their part to prevent or obstruct 
the operations of Government."﻿

many times, he wrote; "...Upon employees in the Federal service rests the 
obligation to serve the whole people, whose interests and welfare require 
orderliness and continuity in the conduct of Government activities. This 
obligation is paramount." To say that Fox lies, but not to tell or say all 
the networks lie shows your arrogance.
